appearances.title: Q&A Rep. James Clyburn D-SC on Pioneering Black Congressmen from South Carolina : CSPAN3 : January 2, 2026 2:29am-3:31am EST
appearances.snippet: don't get along too well with ralph norman. is part of the freedom caucus, and for some strange reason he thinks that because republicans get 53% of the vote in south carolina they are deserving of 100% of the representation. i don't know how you do that. one of the things people found out about me if they cared to look it up, i started advocating for representation as a 20 something year old. i have written editorials, op-ed pieces for the charleston papers on things like proportional voting, which we used to have. illinois had chemo devoting up to a few years ago. the supreme court in many cases accepted cumulative voting as a way to settle voting rights cases. i still have that. some places have started what they call ranked choice voting, but that is not the only way. cumulative voting as a way to do it. proportional voting is a way to do it. ranked choice voting has caught people's fancy, but i really believe that the justice department and the congress itself would do well to look at something other than taking all the el
